messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:19): looking at http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=6684 , could just fix text/* in non-SMTP protocols already?

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:43): Crazy telecoms related things number #3456 we just got PAYG mobile broadband with 3 to fill in the gap before we can convince someone to give us proper useful broadband. To buy time you have to log onto the website. To log on to the website you need a password. They supply the password by SMS. To get the SMS you need either a 3G Phone or a Windows laptop
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:43): because even though they have a OS X version of the client software it doesn't support the SMS feature
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:44): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I recommend a shotgun.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:45): (for you visit to the headquarters to discuss the issue)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:45): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: Oh, I thought you were suggesting suicide

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:46): (Anyway their uselessness pales into comparison compared with tele2 who, two whole months after we first asked for a broadband connection and were told 2-3 weeks, finally decided that we had not been in the country for long enough and so were not entitled to their services)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:47): has anyone tested if nodeName returning in upper case in WebKit for HTML elements is a characteristic of the node itself or its owner document?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:47): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: welcome to Scandinavia
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:47): World's Best Customer Service
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:48): had a pretty good experience with getting IP connectivity to a new apartment
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:48): right on time
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:48): but then, it wasn't ADSL
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:49): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I don't know. Could be fiber optic. The pipe that comes into the apartement is 100 M Ethernet
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:49): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: How much does that cost?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:51): we only pay for 10/10 M, which is 32.90 euros per month. 100/10 M would be 42.90 euros per month
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:52): That sounds roughly similar to Sweden. I think the UK is quite a bit cheaper (or can be)

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:02): hmm. looks like HTML 5 defines the case folding to be dependent on the HTML documentedness of the document and not a property of the element nodes themselves...
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:05): virtuelv: you calling in to widgets call?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:06): and any clues where is marcos?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:17): Hixie: should script-inserted base attribute in the XML namespace be ignored in HTML documents?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:27): Do we want to make createElement in XML documents whose document object implements the HTMLDocument interface create elements in the XHTML namespace?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:30): what do browsers do?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:31): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: I haven't written a test case, I have only read browser source :-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:31): but source says yes
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:31): Gecko's source, that is
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:34): sees http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/content/base/src/nsDocument.cpp#6057
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:35): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, document.createElement("foo").namespaceURI returns the XHTML namespace in an XHTML document.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:36): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: excellent. thanks
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:37): for an SVG document, Opera returns the SVG namespace, but Gecko and WebKit return the XHTML namespace still
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:38): Hixie: Web DOM Core doesn't have renameNode...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:38): Hixie: but HTML 5 places a requirement on its behavior
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:52): Does SetAttributeNode really lower case the name in existing browsers?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:52): Shouldn't instead the attribute node creator method do the lower casing?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:54): files a spec bug

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:58): ddd01b1de2f07d48d4953be350a7944c, I just noticed that the selectors api test suite doesn't contain any tests for the namespace selectors "|foo" and "*|foo", which need to be supported cause they don't need to be resolved
ddd01b1de2f07d48d4953be350a7944c (14:59): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: so the should be handled as if they were the same as "foo", correct?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:00): "|foo" matches elements in no namesace.  i.e. the element created by document.createElementNS("", "foo");
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:00): "*|foo" should match a foo element in any namespace

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:01): for "|foo", you would have to test it by creating elements with createElementNS. You can't rely on any elements in an HTML document being in no namespace, since browsers (and HTML5) say to use the XHTML namespace
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:03): I'll send an email about this to public-webapps as a reminder for this to be added when you have time

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:13): ddd01b1de2f07d48d4953be350a7944c, I just made some quick demos and it looks like WebKit fails the "|p" test. http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/saved/27
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:13): both Opera and Firefox pass that oen
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:13): IE8 will fail because it doesn't support the namespace syntax

ddd01b1de2f07d48d4953be350a7944c (15:14): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: ok, definitely post it to the list then, because I'm cautious of landing changes that'll cause 100%-passing regressions (people get grumpy)
ddd01b1de2f07d48d4953be350a7944c (15:14): it seems painless enough to land, though

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:15): ddd01b1de2f07d48d4953be350a7944c, the whole point of a test suite is to find bugs. If we can find bugs in browsers that currently pass 100%, that's even better.

ddd01b1de2f07d48d4953be350a7944c (15:16): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: absolutely - but I don't want the burdern of notifying and arguing with the vendors to be on me - that should be on the spec people (you)
ddd01b1de2f07d48d4953be350a7944c (15:16): since my only rebuttle will be "Well, f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 told me to add it."
ddd01b1de2f07d48d4953be350a7944c (15:17): just let them know on the list and I'll land it no problem
